layer.name: Causality
layer.definition: Actions have consequences; you reap what you sow.

questions.text: My current spiritual state is largely the accumulated result of past spiritual choices ...

answers.4: mostly — I can see how choices shaped where I am
answers.5: absolutely — I am the accumulated result of my spiritual investments
answers.2: possibly — but I don't see the connections clearly
answers.3: partially — some of it traces back, some feels random
answers.1: not really — spirituality feels given, not built

questions.text: Habitual sin grows from seeds I planted and watered ...

answers.4: usually — I can trace most habits back to small beginnings
answers.5: always — nothing is sudden; everything has a causal chain
answers.2: possibly — but it feels more sudden than that
answers.3: sometimes — some habits have visible roots, others just appear

questions.text: Spiritually mature people got there through specific practices over time ...

answers.4: mostly — maturity is built through consistent practice
answers.5: definitely — the path is open to anyone who walks it
answers.2: possibly — but it seems like some have special grace
answers.3: partly — effort matters, but so does something I can't identify
answers.1: not necessarily — some people are just more spiritual

questions.text: 'Sowing to the Spirit' (Galatians 6:8) means specific actions produce specific results ...
questions.principle: Biblical sowing/reaping is concrete, not metaphorical

answers.4: generally — spiritual cause and effect is real
answers.5: precisely — sow to the Spirit, reap life; sow to flesh, reap decay
answers.2: possibly — but the connections are vague
answers.3: sometimes — some spiritual sowing produces clear results

questions.text: Asking God to change my spiritual state without changing my inputs is ...
questions.principle: Faith cooperates with causality; it doesn't bypass it

answers.5: asking for magic, not faith — faith works through action
answers.3: mixed — He can act, but I probably need to do something too

remediation.advice: Holiness is not a lottery. It's agriculture. Study people you admire spiritually — what did they plant? What can you plant today that will produce that harvest in 5 years?

scripture.text: Since we have these promises, dear friends, let us purify ourselves from everything that contaminates body and spirit, perfecting holiness out of reverence for God.
